meanings.definition: To uproot or remove from one's native or accustomed environment.
meanings.sent1: The farmer was deracinating the old tree to make space for new crops.
meanings.sent2: The hurricane was deracinating trees all around the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was deracinating all the acorns from the tree, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The new construction project was deracinating the familiar landscape of the town.
meanings.sent5: The act of deracinating the ancient artifact from its resting place revealed hidden secrets.

meanings.definition: To displace or remove from a place or situation.
meanings.sent1: The flood was deracinating families from their homes, forcing them to seek shelter.
meanings.sent2: The new road construction project was deracinating the local wildlife from their habitats.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was deracinating all the toys from the shelf, creating a mess.
meanings.sent4: The sudden job transfer was deracinating him from his comfortable routine.
meanings.sent5: The strong winds were deracinating the fallen leaves, scattering them in all directions.
